bibl.title: Letter from Lillian M. Elliott to Emilie L. Reed, April 11, 1927

div1.p: Elliott informs Mrs. Reed of a talk on Walter Reed by James Peabody, and encloses two student papers on Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Lillian M. Elliott to Emilie L. Reed, April 11, 1927
div1.opener:
E. H. S. FORM NO. 21
Telephone Monument 8292
BOARD OF EDUCATION
THE CITY OF NEW YORK
HARLEM EVENING HIGH SCHOOL
FOR WOMEN
114th Street between 7th and 8th Avenues
LILLIAN M. ELLIOT, Principal
NEW YORK,.....April 11 1927
Mrs. Walter Reed
Hotel Burlington
Vermont Ave.
Washington, D.C.
My dear Mrs Reed,
div1.p:
The great admirer of your husband's,
Dr. Peabody, gave our school a spirited talk on your husband's
work for humanity. Before the talk two of the students read
original papers enc. 1; enc. 2 copies of which, at Dr. Peabody's suggestion,
I am sending to you.

We hope you are well on the road to recovery
by this time.
